alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 28 at 2:26PM MST until September 28 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 400 PM MST. * At 226 PM MST, an area of blowing dust was near La Palma, or 8 miles south of Coolidge, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 176 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 167 and 178. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 124 and 155. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Florence, Coolidge, Arizona City, La Palma, Blackwater, Toltec, Coolidge Airport, Olberg, Arizola, Randolph, Valley Farms, Sacaton and Santan. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
